item.title: Direction of Gradient Descent Update
item.author: Han
item.description: On Gradient Descent Gradient is a vector function that represents a direction of steepest increase of a function to be differentiated at a certain point. For example, a convex function $z = ax^2+by^2$ has a gradient $[2ax, 2by]$. Its steepest descent direction is $[-2ax, -2by]$. At the point $x_0,y_0$, the gradient direction for the function is $2ax_0(y-y_0) = 2by_0(x-x_0)$. But then the lowest point $(x,y) = (0,0)$ does not lie on the line.
